text_image_relationship.layout_style: Single column of text above and below a two-register full-width illustration; margins contain glosses in a cursive hand. The image is divided by an architectural arcade into an upper siege scene and a lower massacre scene, with a uniform decorative border framing both registers.

text_content.script_style: Gothic textura quadrata with extensive use of abbreviations and ligatures; marginal glosses in a later cursive hand

color_scheme.color_usage: Gold grounds unify divine and narrative spaces; ultramarine frames and backgrounds emphasize key actions; red and blue garments alternate to create visual rhythm; green used sparingly for foliage motifs; white and silver provide contrast in horses and armor; layered application with white highlights on drapery folds; overall pigments are well preserved with minimal darkening.

features: Two horizontal registers delineating stages of the story
Architectural arcade as a unifying frame
Dense clustering of figures to indicate action
Central mounted warrior as focal point in upper register
Vertical spear lines directing the eye downward toward lower register

decorative_elements: Gothic micro-architecture arcade with crenellations dividing registers
Stylized trefoil and quatrefoil motifs in border
Interlaced vine scrolls in margin gloss frames
Alternating gold and colored diaper pattern in lower background
Punch-work on gold leaf creating dotted texture

drawing_technique.line_style: Fluid quill pen work with bold outer contours and fine internal hatch lines; brown ink underdrawing visible under magnification
drawing_technique.shading_method: Subtle white highlighting on robes and horses; parallel hatching in drapery folds; minimal gradation relying on color fields
drawing_technique.perspective_handling: Hierarchical scaling of central figures; overlapping to suggest depth; no true linear perspective

scene_relationships.subject: Siege and assault on the city walls by Joshua's forces
scene_relationships.relationship_to_next: Leads to the massacre and dispersal of the defeated inhabitants
visual_connections: Consistent gold background unites both registers
Blue frame border continues around both scenes
Spears and lances point downward toward lower register
Repeated red and blue tunic palette across figures
Gothic arch motif echoing city gate appears again below

scene_relationships.subject: Massacre of the defeated inhabitants and presentation of captives
visual_connections: Gold diapered ground matches upper gold sky
Clustered figure groups mirror the density of the siege above
Architectural trefoil patterns repeat across the top of register
Spearmen from upper scene visually reappear at right

visual_continuity: Ultramarine frame and border encloses both registers
Consistent figure proportions and helmet types
Alternating red and blue garment pattern
Gothic arcade and trefoil motifs unify layout

content_theme.scene_description: In the upper register, a full-width siege scene depicts approximately fourteen mounted and foot soldiers assaulting a crenellated city gate. Central is a mounted warrior—identified as Joshua—on a rearing white horse, clad in chainmail hauberk and a white surcoat, gripping a sword in his right hand and directing his troops. To his left, knights in conical helmets and kite shields bear down on a folding wooden gate with spears, while others scale the wall with ladders. Fallen soldiers lie at the rampart’s base, their mail torn and helms askew. The city architecture is rendered in brick-red towers with crenellations and a pointed gatehouse. Figures wear surcoats of vermillion red and ultramarine blue, with minimal green accents on trim. The composition is compressed, creating a sense of urgency: overlapping limbs, diagonal spear shafts, and bodies in varied postures define the action. Depth is implied by layering: foreground horse hooves obscure fallen men, midground troops advance, and background the city wall. The horses are naturalistically modeled in white and spotted grey, with bridles and caparisons detailed in gilt and pigment. This scene establishes both the military momentum and the divine mandate that Joshua’s forces wield against the enemy.

secular: Armored knights in chainmail hauberks, conical helmets, carrying kite shields painted red or blue with simple cross motifs
Foot soldiers in short tunics and mail chausses, wielding spears and swords
Mounted leader figure on white horse, wearing a white surcoat over mail and a conical helm
Group of spearmen on foot at lower register, standing solemnly as captives are displayed

objects: Spears held by standing captors in lower register
architectural: Crenellated brick-red city wall with gatehouse and pointed towers
Gothic micro-architecture arcade dividing registers with trefoil openings

technical_features.material: Premium calf vellum of uniform thickness and creamy tone; surface smoothed and pumiced, with faint ruling lines visible under magnification
technical_features.preservation_condition: Overall well preserved: pigments vibrant with slight flaking in red areas, minimal darkening of silver highlights, gold leaf remains bright; minor edge cockling and one contemporary repair at lower margin
notable_physical_characteristics: Raised gesso under gold leaf with punched dot pattern
Visible brown ink underdrawing uplifted under infrared reflectography
Regular ruling in plummet defines text lines and image frame
Layered pigment application evident in drapery folds
Fine brush stippling in flesh tones

analysis.scholarly_interpretation: This two-register illustration likely dates to a Parisian workshop c. 1250–1270, produced for a Bible Historiale or similar scholastic compendium. The use of burnished gold leaf backgrounds and ultramarine pigments indicates a high-status commission, while the Gothic textura quadrata script and cursive marginalia attest to collaborative production between professional illuminators and subsequent readers. Stylistically, the composition reveals the influence of the English Channel School in its fluid penwork and lively figure clusters, yet the crisp architectural framing and alternating color palette align with Parisian conventions. Technically, the raised gesso and punched ornament under the gold leaf demonstrate advanced material handling, while the visible underdrawing suggests careful planning of figure placement. Iconographically, Joshua’s assault and subsequent massacre underscore typological parallels between Old Testament conquest and Christian deliverance, reinforcing divine sanction of righteous warfare. Politically, the martial imagery would have resonated with contemporary French nobles engaged in crusading endeavors, projecting both spiritual and temporal authority. Comparatively, this folio shares compositional features with the Psalter of Blanche of Castile, notably the alternating red-and-blue tunics and trefoil arcade, yet it innovates through its two-tier narrative grid and dynamic diagonal spear shafts that guide the viewer’s gaze. Overall, the page exemplifies mid-13th-century advances in sequential storytelling, integrating theological instruction with vivid visual drama for an educated ecclesiastical or academic audience.
